Build: Eclipse 3.1RC1

I got the following during shutdown (I think).

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.refresh.win32.Win32Monitor.run(Win32Monitor.java:515)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Tom, should it be possible for Platform.getBundle() to be returning null after a
plugin has shutdown (but was previously running successfully)? From looking at
the implementation, this should only happen if the bundle is in the INSTALLED or
UNINSTALLED states.

We should add a null check here regardless, since Plaform.getBundle(...)
specifies that it may return null.  CCing DJ for approval of adding null check.

When the framework is shutdown all bundle states are set to INSTALLED because 
we have thrown away all the classloaders and the RESOLVED state of all the 
bundles.  This would cause null to be returned here.

It looks like a job thread was still active after the framework has shutdown.  
Is that possible John?

Yes, the job is canceled on shutdown, and the job checks for cancelation fairly
often, but there is a timing hole if the job is running as resources shuts down
and has not yet checked for cancelation. I will add the null check for RC2.
